author: Damon Martin
title: Joe Rogan returns to broadcast team for historic UFC 306 card at Las Vegas Sphere
text:
The UFC 306 broadcast team is set for the historic event at the Sphere in Las Vegas with plans to celebrate Mexican Independence Day throughout the night.
After missing out on UFC 305 in Australia because he doesnâ€™t travel to international cards, Joe Rogan returns to serve as color commentator alongside UFC Hall of Famer Daniel Cormier . Like usual, Jon Anik handles play-by-play duties for the event.
In the arena, Megan Olivi handles reporting with Din Thomas serving as the sideline coach throughout the broadcast on ESPNâ€™s networks including the ESPN+ pay-per-view.
UFC officials confirmed the broadcast plans to MMA Fighting on Thursday.
While the broadcast team is largely the same for every major pay-per-view event, this card isnâ€™t the typical UFC show with elaborate plans for production built around the card as the Sphere.
With massive LED screens surrounding the circular arena, the UFC production team in coordination with ESPN plans to roll out a much different look for the pay-per-view that kicks off next Saturday night from Las Vegas.
The fights on the card will also feature different backgrounds throughout the show with the LED screens being utilized even when the action is taking place inside the octagon.
UFC CEO Dana White revealed recently that the promotion has invested more than $20 million for the event, which is an unprecedented investment for a single pay-per-view. Itâ€™s likely this is the first and only card that the UFC will produce at the Sphere with the company still maintaining a relationship with MGM, who owns and operates the T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.
UFC 306 is headlined by a pair of title fights as Sean Oâ€™Malley defends his bantamweight championship against Merab Dvalishvili while Alexa Grasso faces off with Valentina Shevchenko with the flyweight title on the line in the co-main event.

author: Marion Pignot
title: Des nuits de plus en plus chaudes pour 30 % de la population mondiale
text: Des nuits de plus en plus chaudes pour 30 % de la population mondialeÃ§a se rÃ©chauffeâ€¢Selon une analyse scientifique parue ce jeudi, le nombre de nuits dÃ©passant 25Â°C a dÃ©jÃ  considÃ©rablement augmentÃ© pour environ un tiers de la population mondiale. Ce qui nâ€™est pas sans consÃ©quences pour la santÃ© 20 Minutes avec AFP Le changement climatique rÃ©chauffe les tempÃ©ratures de la planÃ¨te le jour, mais aussi la nuitâ€¦. Selon une analyse menÃ©e par Climate Central, un groupe indÃ©pendant de scientifiques et de spÃ©cialistes de la communication sur le climat, le nombre de nuits dÃ©passant 25Â°C a dÃ©jÃ  considÃ©rablement augmentÃ© pour environ un tiers de la population mondiale et ce, alors que lâ€™Organisation mondiale de la santÃ© ( [OMS](https://www.20minutes.fr/dossier/oms)) recommande de maintenir la tempÃ©rature ambiante Ã  24Â°C ou en dessous pendant la nuit. TrinitÃ©-et-Tobago, dans les CaraÃ¯bes, a connu lâ€™augmentation moyenne la plus importante de tous les pays, avec 47 nuits supplÃ©mentaires par an au-dessus de 25 degrÃ©s Celsius. La ville indienne de [Bombay](https://www.20minutes.fr/dossier/bombay) a subi deux mois supplÃ©mentaires de nuits chaudes. Des conditions qui peuvent devenir mortelles Au-dessus de 24Â°C, le sommeil devient inconfortable, ce qui peut avoir un impact sur la santÃ© des personnes vulnÃ©rables (bÃ©bÃ©s, personnes Ã¢gÃ©es ou souffrant de maladies chroniques). Un danger rÃ©el confirmÃ© par Nick Obradovich, scientifique en chef au Laureate Institute for Brain Research, basÃ© aux [Etats-Unis](https://www.20minutes.fr/monde/etats-unis/) : Â« les tempÃ©ratures nocturnes plus Ã©levÃ©es, en particulier pendant les pÃ©riodes chaudes de lâ€™annÃ©e, peuvent nuire au sommeil et rÃ©duire la rÃ©cupÃ©ration physique Ã  la suite de tempÃ©ratures diurnes Ã©levÃ©es, ce qui peut avoir des rÃ©percussions en cascade sur la santÃ©. Â» Il ajoute, bien quâ€™il nâ€™ait pas participÃ© Ã  lâ€™Ã©tude, que le seuil de 25Â°C Â« nâ€™est pas une valeur absolue en dessous de laquelle la santÃ© est bonne et au-dessus de laquelle elle se dÃ©tÃ©riore Â», mais elle entraÃ®ne des consÃ©quences variables selon les personnes, notamment si Ã  la chaleur sâ€™ajoute de lâ€™humiditÃ©, crÃ©ant parfois des conditions qui peuvent devenir mortelles.

author: Chris Roling
title: Joe Mixon scores 2 TDs to put Bengals over Browns
text:
Sunday felt like a game where a veteran Cincinnati Bengals player might go off for a big performance while setting the tone for the upcoming offseason.
It turns out that veteran was running back Joe Mixon.
In the first quarter alone, Mixon rushed six times for 80 yards, with one of those attempts a huge 44-yard gain to put him up over the 1,000-yard mark on the season.
Mixon also rushed for a touchdown and his lone catch of the quarter went for a touchdown, too, giving his team a 14-point lead going into the second quarter.
Hereâ€™s a look at the scores from Mixon:
Dancing in the end zoneâ€¦ the best sight ðŸ•º #EasyToCelebrate | @budlight pic.twitter.com/hJu2BzHRUQ
â€” Cincinnati Bengals (@Bengals) January 7, 2024
Mixon back in the end zoneâ€¼ï¸ pic.twitter.com/8QzsxWiB8a

author: Dexter Cabalza
title: DMW: 8 of 21 Filipino crew of besieged MV Eternity C rescued
text:
Department of Migrant Workers Sec. Hans Leo Cacdac in this file photo. He said on Thursday eight of 21 Filipino crew of the ill-fated MV Eternity C were rescued. Arnel Tacson/INQUIRER.net
MANILA, Philippines â€” Eight of the 21 Filipino crew of the ill-fated MV Eternity C were rescued as of Thursday, after the bulk carrier was attacked by Houthi rebels in the Red Sea.
The Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) remains hopeful that the remaining 13 still unaccounted Filipino seafarers are alive and safe with rescue operations ongoing. This was amid reports that at least three of the shipâ€™s crew were killed and several others were abducted and currently held by the Iran-aligned Islamist group.
Article continues after this advertisement In a Palace press briefing, DMW Sec. Hans Cacdac said five Filipino crew of MV Eternity C were rescued after they were found in the seas by responding rescue teams.
FEATURED STORIES GLOBALNATION Brother of Duterte adviser arrested for multiple criminal offenses GLOBALNATION Alan Cayetano pushes for Rodrigo Duterte release, house arrest GLOBALNATION Man who killed cats in Singapore has jail term doubled to 27 months READ: Marcos orders aid for PH seafarersâ€™ kin after vessel sinks in Red Sea
Three more Filipino seafarers were added to the survivors, he said in an interview on dzBB on Thursday afternoon.
Although they spent more than 24 hours in the water, the DMW chief said they were in â€œgood condition.â€
â€œNone of them has serious physical injury or illness. But of course, it is safe to say that they may have some physical stress with what they went through,â€ he added.
Article continues after this advertisement According to Cacdac, the rescued Filipinos were on the way to a safe destination, which he did not disclose for security reasons.
â€œThe Philippine government will do all we can to provide necessary assistance to them, starting with medical, physical and mental health assistance,â€ he noted.
Article continues after this advertisement Cacdac said the DMW already started on Wednesday night their personal visits to each of the families of the Filipino crew members, with President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. ordering to provide all help to each of them.
â€œWe have assured them of the Presidentâ€™s directive to take care of them, and we will do everything so we can provide assistance to them,â€ he added.
Others still unaccounted The government already received information from the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations, through the Philippine defense attache in Bahrain, that at least three Filipinos were killed but â€œthis is still subject to confirmation.â€
Maritime security forces said Houthis attacked Eternity C with sea drones and rocket-propelled grenades fired from speed boats.
The Liberia-flagged and Greece-operated MV Eternity C was attacked by Houthis while it was 50 nautical miles west of Hodeidah, Yemen, on July 7 to early hours of July 8 in Manila time.
It has 22 crew members on board â€” 21, including the captain, were Filipinos; and one Russian. Three armed guards were also on board, including one Greek and one Indian, who was one of those rescued.
The United States Mission in Yemen accused the Houthis of kidnapping many surviving crew members from MV Eternity C and called for their immediate and unconditional safe release.
The DMW has suspended the license of the manning agency and principal of MV Eternity C, with Cacdac saying they would also pursue civil and criminal remedies as investigation rolls.
â€œWe are not happy, of course, with the way things [were] done out in terms of allowing the crew to sail to a high-risk zone,â€ Cacdac said.
Multiple violations Based on its initial investigation, the manning agency and the principal committed several violations, including failure to comply with the strict reportorial processes and other critical requirements prior to sailing.
â€œWorse, the ship traversed the Red Sea not once but twice,â€ Cacdac noted.
Under DMW Department Order No. 1 issued in March 2024, shipowners and manning agencies are mandated to report planned passages through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden and ensure Filipino crew members are fully informed of the risks involved. Filipino seafarers have the right to refuse to sail in these so-called warlike zones.
The ship originated from Egypt and unloaded its cargo in Berbera, Somalia. It was supposed to depart for Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, but got attacked upon reaching the Red Sea west of Hodeidah, Yemen.
READ: In 2 Houthi attacks, 17 Filipinos safe; PH checking on 21 others
It was the second attack of Houthis in the same week. The Houthis also have claimed responsibility for MV Magic Seas.
All 17 Filipino crew from MV Magic Seas were rescued before it sank. They are set to arrive in Manila on July 11.
Meanwhile, the DMW is eyeing to impose tighter regulations in the deployment of Filipino seafarers after the attacks of Houthi rebels against two Filipino-manned vessels in the Red Sea.
Cacdac did not directly answer if a temporary stoppage of deployment of Filipino seafarers would be recommended to President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
â€œWe are seeking the help of political and security experts, as well as the DFA (Department of Foreign Affairs) and the DND (Department of National Defense), to analyze or tell us how the situation has changed or worsened. Of course we know that the Houthis have skips, RPGs and ballistic missiles, but we want to know the intensity and the tenor of the Houthi side with respect to these particular attacks,â€ he said.
